commits.comment: moving XmlSchema from CVS
Code cleanup, use official QName class.

Some more work - make XmlSchemaCollection (might need to change that name) the focus of read()ing schemas in.  Enable searching for elements/types by QName in a collection.  Only store the local name of types/elements, get the namespace from the enclosing XmlSchema object.  Fix problem with forward references (we now correctly slot the type values into waiting element/attribute declarations when types are encountered - still need to complain when unresolved types are NOT resolved by the end of a parse.
Give individual schemas access to their parent collections, and default to building the jar.
Add some useful Constants

fix for AXIS2-303 - XmlSchema builder doesn't work if the schema isn't the root node from Dan Diephouse

Updated the schema builder to handle namespaces inside the elements. The earlier code did not handle the  following case   <xs:element name="inChar" type="q1:char" xmlns:q1="http://x.com/2003/10/Serialization/"/> Now the namspace resolution first looks for nay namespace decalration in it's own scope befoe moving on to the parent.

Added a testcase and the relevant xsd resource - Note . This test resource is NOT complete. Needs to include all the derived types to test the schema fully
1. Updated the simple types. Now it seems that all the necessary simple types (including the derived ones) are added 2. Updated the test schema

XmlSchema serialization was declaring the attributes like elementFormDefault, attributeFormDefault under the schema namespace. This behavior is clearly wrong and caused a issue in JDK 1.5. In JDK 1.4 the mistake was not noticed due to an erroneous use of the qualified name parameter. Corrected the above issue

1. Added a new constants class to keep the values like "any","lax" and so on    The original problem is wrongful content case (camelcase instead of lowercase) 2. Fixed a serialization issue where anyAttribute was serialized before attributes (which is invalid as per the schema spec) 3. Added two new test cases to test the new changes
changed the use of getTagName to getLocalName. The logic in the createNewElement method is not correct for processing the tag name!

The write method of the XMLSchema always serialized all the schemas (including imported ones) and took the first schema. This is wrong behavior 1.Changed the default behavior to serialize only the relevant schema 2.Added a new method to get all schemas as DOM documents
1. Annotations are serialized twice for the enums (and other facets). Fixed that issue. 2. Annotations in group serialization had a problem with the order! fixed that too
making the created jar automatically copied to the local repository.

Added support for registering an external resolver - a long waited feature :) 1. Introduced the URIResolver interface and the default implementation for the URI resolver 2. changed the schema builder to use the resolver to resolve the schemas
Fixing minor error in the group id
A small fix to handle the case where the schema location is missing for the import!
Changed the access modifier to protected for the default resolver. This makes it easy to extend this
The schema serializaton had a wrong order for imports and inlcudes - fixed it

NOTICE.txt
fix names
Fixing a namespace issue.For references in attribute types that do not contain a namespace prefix the schemabuilder picked up the targetNamespace. it should be the default namespace!

Fixed a minor issue in the SchemaBuilder. When the schema has no target namespace the parent schemas targetnamespace was added as the default namespace. This functionality was changed not to put anything

1. Changed the getTextContent to getNodeValue. The former is a DOM level 3 API feature which is not supported in JK 1.4. The getNodeValue is supported in both the API's

1. Moved the block constants to an inner class inside the Constants class for clarity. Presence of multiple constant files is confusing! 2. Added functionality to populate a metadata map when external attributes are present. When external attributes are present they are populated as QName/value pairs into a map and stored in the metadata map under the key EXTERNAL_ATTRIBUTES (constant is Constants.MetaDataConstants.EXTERNAL_ATTRIBUTES) 3. Added a new test case and the relevant test case xsd file to test this functionality

WSCOMMONS-61: When the targetNamespace is absent the effective namespace for use in QName objects is "". Emptystring isn't listed in the schema_ns as it isn't explicitly defined in the schema. Therefore looking up a prefix for the "" namespace returns null and a "temporary" 'genXXX' prefix is genereated. This fix prevents the temporary namespace being created when the namespace is "". The "" prefix is used.

WSCOMMONS-266 Contributor:Brian Murphy Change to the pom to explicitly specify the TransformerFactory via a System Property. This is necessary because the default TransformerFactory changes depending on the version of the JDK and JDK vendor.  This change helps stablize the tests and provides guidance for real world users who run into similar issues.

Previous commit broke the XmlSchema build on Sun derived 1.5 vms (Solaris and OS X at least) as the xalan classes have been repackaged. This change reverts the default behaviour. To run the build pointing to the classes packaged in an IBM JVM, run the build with a -DisIBM=true For info about the sun renaming see http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/guide/xml/jaxp/JAXP-Compatibility_150.html#packageNames
Formatting changes, plus a swap of args to make test slightly clearer.

Added NPE guard.  The schema reference may be null, so check it is not before using it to get an element.  The original code was added under revision 587375. This NPE was encountered by Axis2 ADB-Codegen tests.

1. Adding  a comment about redefine handling  This seems to be an issue we need to discuss in the mailing list. I'm thinking that the behavior of the schema object model should not be validating and if the redefine is missing the parent then the object model should not be generating faults. However it would be convenient (just as in the case of getElement/Type) to have at least some utility methods that allows one to search through the full import/include/redefine hierarchy.
